entry.title: Workshops and Activation for CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY and CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
entry.summary:
In the recent correspondence, significant attention has been directed towards the review and analysis of CTV (CheckTemplateVerify) code. The discussion not only encompasses prior examinations in different pull requests but also extends to application developers interested in exploring various use cases. The dialogue elaborates on the transfer of repository ownership, reflecting a collaborative spirit in managing and enhancing the repository content.
Furthermore, the conversation highlights the utility of an external resource, specifically pointing out the value found in the taproot workshops repository. This acknowledgment paves the way for the establishment of a new repository dedicated to CTV-CSFS (CheckTemplateVerify-Client-Side Filtering Support) workshops, meetings, and related documentation. Such an initiative is indicative of a proactive approach to consolidating and sharing knowledge and resources within the community.
The detailed planning for an upcoming workshop on 28 August 2025 at 15:00 UTC is shared, including the venue being the ctv-csfs-activation channel on libera.chat. The agenda for this workshop is twofold: firstly, to review and comprehend BIP 119 (Bitcoin Improvement Proposal 119), and secondly, to engage in practical exercises creating basic CTV transactions on the signet. This endeavor not only aims at deepening the understanding of CTV but also at fostering practical skills among participants.
The communication concludes with a note on the recipient's subscription to the Google Groups "Bitcoin Development Mailing List," which serves as the medium through which this message was disseminated. For further exploration and insights, the links to the [taproot workshops](https://github.com/bitcoinops/taproot-workshop) and [BIP 119](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0119.mediawiki) are provided, offering direct access to these valuable resources.
